channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Sewage leaking, 25th November
item.description:
The path outside the entrance of the Jet petrol garage on Chipperfield road has liquid coming out that smells strongly of sewage. When walking, people are having to step over this liquid. The smell nearly makes me throw up as walking past, makes me heave too so I know its affecting other people. The liquid crosses the path & travels along side the kurb down the road. The smell is also travelling through the pipes & coming into my flat via the pipes & windows. This is a constant issue that needs fixing immediately as affecting people & nearby flats. The smell has also entered my washing machine pipes meaning I'm not able to do washing. It also comes through my kitchen sink. The problem is located at the entrance of the JET petrol garage on Chipperfield Road BR52FE
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Chipperfield Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The metal drain cover is loose and the surrounding road is breaking up. Large vehicles could throw up parts if the road or even the drain cover itself, 25th November

item.title: Tree needs replacing after storm, 25th November
item.description:
This tree fell a few months ago during high winds and the stump has remained in position with a bit of yellow tape around it. When will a new tree be planted? It would be a great shame if this area was covered in tarmac like the previous tree near the co-op.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Haslemere Road, Barnehurst, Greater London

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Signage missing on roadworks, 25th November
item.description:
SGN have roadworks in place permit XW016W122261796-00617-02 refers. The works have a temporary traffic regulation order in place restricting parking on Salisbury Road. Cones are out but no signage resulting in vehicles parking where the are prohibited. As traffic is queueing due to the temporary lights the illegally parked cars are blocking the road which in turn blocks the junction. An ambulance was blocked earlier. Signage & enforcement of the no parking is required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 17 and 19 Dyne Road, 25th November
item.description:
It has been now more than one month or 2 that there is park space block for works in the back of the gardens, there is no official work license. Every day a big truck comes and blocks several parking spaces including the one that they have put some orange barriers and metal barres blocking the spaces. No license or permission seen anywhere. They said they are building two houses at the back of the garden.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dyne Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
